description.narrative: Expected ResultsUnder the overarching project output of:The peace process in Yemen is supported with fast, flexible initiatives, agreed by the parties, that deliver tangible, rapid improvements in the daily lives of people, and reinforce and build public support for the political process;the following components will be implemented. Component 1: Initiatives agreed by the parties, in direct support of priorities discussed during the peace consultations, are implemented to build confidence in the peace process. By supporting specific initiatives recommended by the UN Special Envoy and parties in the peace process, the Facility will help to demonstrate concrete alternatives to conflict, create local demand for peace and incentivize parties to deepen their engagement in the Special Envoy’s peace process. Initiatives under the Facility will help build confidence between the parties, and between the parties and the UN. The first set of initiatives implemented under this component will support priorities discussed by the parties during the December 2018 peace consultations in Stockholm. Component 2: Initiatives identified by the Special Envoy that further support broad peace efforts and the peace process are implemented. The Facility will empower the Special Envoy to direct rapid support initiatives that generate demand for the peace process, particularly in neglected geographical areas and among underrepresented groups. Particular attention will be paid to promoting the inclusion of women. These initiatives will help lay the groundwork for people to start rebuilding their lives, by improving conditions in conflict- impacted communities and facilitating the return of displaced families. This may include public work schemes and rebuilding basic public infrastructure and will prioritise the use of local contractors in order to generate employment and stimulate the local economy.

Stöd till en fredsfond som ska stärka förutsättningarna att genomföra överenskomna steg (genom Stockholmsavtalet, december 2018) mot en fredlig lösning av konflikten i Jemen. Fredsfonden är utformad för att stödja fredsprocessen med snabba, flexibla initativ som överenskommits av partnerna och som levererar konkreta, snabba förbättringar i människors dagliga liv och förstärker och bygger offentligt stöd för den politiska processen.

Support to a Peace Support Facility which aims at strenthening the possibilites of the implementation of the Stockholm agreement to enhace the prerequisites for a peaceful solution of the conflict in Yemen. The Facility is designed to support the peace process with fast, flexible initiatives, agreed by the parties, that deliver tangible, rapid improvements in the daily lives of people and reinforce and build public support for the political process.

tag.narrative: 14.2 - By 2020, sustainably manage and protect marine and coastal ecosystems to avoid significant adverse impacts, including by strengthening their resilience, and take action for their restoration in order to achieve healthy and productive oceans.

14.2 - Senast 2020 förvalta och skydda marina och kustnära ekosystem på ett hållbart sätt för att undvika betydande negativa konsekvenser, bland annat genom att stärka deras motståndskraft, samt vidta åtgärder för att återställa dem i syfte att uppnå friska och produktiva hav.
16.1 - Avsevärt minska alla former av våld och dödligt våld överallt.
16.1 - Significantly reduce all forms of violence and related death rates everywhere.
16.7 - Ensure responsive, inclusive, participatory and representative decision-making at all levels.
16.7 - Säkerställa ett lyhört, inkluderande, deltagandebaserat och representativt beslutsfattande på alla nivåer.

title.narrative: Third party cost sharing agreement UNDP-Sida för Yemen Peace Support Facility
Beslut om insats Jemen Pece Support Facility 2019-2022

description.narrative:
Output 1: The implementation of the Stockholm agreement or any other future agreement are supported through initiatives agreed by the parties. - A comprehensive damage assessment of the Ports of Hodeidah, Salif and Ras Issa was undertaken, and priority rehabilitation interventions identified; - The works for the rehabilitation of the Training Center of Port Hodeidah have started and procurement for the remaining interventions is ongoing; - A partner was contracted to support OSESGY to prepare for the monitoring of ceasefire initiatives.
Output 2: Discreet activities emerging out of Track II initiatives are implemented with the goal of catalyzing the political process. - PSF swiftly responded to OSESGY request for support on port revenue management; - Preparations for the operationalization of PSF window 2.
Output 3: Transitional governance and post-peace agreement arrangements are supported as and when the parties agree. This output has not been activated yet as it is contingent upon discussion and buy-in from the warring parties.
Output 4: The Project Management Unit of the Peace Support Facility is set up and operational. - 81% of PSF staff has been recruited.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
